definition: to follow/from/it is for...to/reason/cause/because of/due to/to/to leave it (to sb)/by (introduces passive verb)
to put/to place/to release/to free/to let go/to let out/to set off (fireworks)
surname Ren/Ren County 任縣|任县[Ren2 Xian4] in Hebei

to assign/to appoint/to take up a post/office/responsibility/to let/to allow/to give free rein to/no matter (how, what etc)/classifier for terms served in office, or for spouses, girlfriends etc (as in 前任男友)

sentences.english: Hong Kong, of course, sets greater store by laissez-faire principles.
sentences.chinese: 當然香港更加重視自由放任的原則。

sentences.english: Modern accounting has followed a developmental path from Laze fare to governmental regulation.
sentences.chinese: 現代會計的發展走過了從自由放任到政府監管的歷程。

sentences.english: The third major element has been the creation of corporatist welfare and the abandonment of laissez faire.
sentences.chinese: 第三個主要因素已建立社團的福利和放棄自由放任。

sentences.english: That doctrine of laissez faire which so often in our history.
sentences.chinese: 在我國曆史上屢見不鮮的自由放任主義原則。

sentences.english: There has never been an era of laisser-faire in the history of stock exchange in the United States.
sentences.chinese: 美國證券交易史上從來就不存在自由放任的時代。

sentences.english: The decentralization of power appeals to individualism and libertarian humanism .
sentences.chinese: 分散權力迎合自由放任主義和自由人道主義。

sentences.english: The decentralization of power appeals to individualism and libertarian humanism.
sentences.chinese: 分散權力迎合自由放任主義和自由人道主義。

sentences.english: All these are vital modifications to the laissez-faire model.
sentences.chinese: 所有這一切，都是對“自由放任”模式的重要修改。

pinyin: zi4 you2 yi4 zhi4 zhu3 yi4

definition: Adam Smith (1723-1790), Scottish ethical philosopher and pioneer economist, author of The Wealth of Nations 國富論|国富论

pinyin: she4 hui4 min2 zhu3 zhu3 yi4
